name: Famous Deaths Quiz | People by Country | 10 Questions

questions.text: At what battle did Stonewall Jackson die?
questions.explanation:
Chancellorsville.

	He was shot by his own men by accident.

questions.text: Alexander Hamilton died in a duel with Aaron Burr. How did the duel come about?
options: The duel was arranged by others
questions.explanation:
Burr challenged Hamilton.

	Hamilton felt honor-bound to accept the challenge, issued by Burr, after long enmity between the two.

questions.text: Wolfe and Montcalm confronted each other on the Plains of Abraham in a key battle in the French and Indian War. How did they fare?
questions.explanation:
Both died.

	There were mere hours between the two deaths.

questions.text: Which president died on the fiftieth anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation:
Jefferson.

	John Adams also died on the same day.

questions.text: Who did NOT perish at the Alamo?
questions.explanation:
Sam Houston.

	Houston avenged the victims.

questions.text: How did famed explorer Henry Hudson meet his end?
questions.explanation:
Mutiny by his crew.

	His crew set him adrift and he perished at sea.

questions.text: Which famous American died under mysterious circumstances?
questions.explanation:
Meriwether Lewis.

	Lewis died while travelling through the U.S. There is some question as to the cause: suicide, murder, or natural causes.

questions.text: What famous Indian Leader died at the Battle of Wounded Knee?
questions.explanation:
Big Foot.

	Big Foot. The massacre marked the end of the Indian conquest.

questions.text: Pocahontas intervened to save the life of what explorer?
questions.explanation:
John Smith.

	She saved Smith - but married another.

questions.text: Robert Ford is the assassin of:
questions.explanation:
Jesse James.

	'The dirty little coward went and shot poor Mr. Howard'. Mr. Howard was Jesse's identity after 'retired'.
